page.title: 04WERRINGTON MANSION
page.content: Although the history of Werrington starts during the reign of Edgar (958-979), most of the present house dates from 1641, built by Francis Drake, nephew of Sir Francis Drake. . In 1704 the present front was added, very little has been altered since.A fire, which badly damaged the Elizabethan part in 1976, was mainly confined to the roof. The house today is owned by Mr.R.Williams Esq., whose family bought the Estate in 1882.It is very much a family home for Mr. & Mrs. Williams, their two daughters and two sons.It is not open to the public. However,during the shooting season, lunches are held in the Servants' Hall (this apartment still retains its old name)and various parish and local functions are also held there. Very occasionallyfunctions are held in the main part of the Mansion.
